title: Commission Regulation (EEC) No 2758/90 of 26 September 1990 determining for the Member States the estimated loss of income and the estimated level of the premium payable per ewe and per female goat and fixing the second half-yearly advance for the 1990 marketing year
header:
COMMISSION  REGULATION (EEC) No 2758/90
of 26 September 1990
determining for the Member States the estimated loss of income and the estimated level of the premium payable per ewe and per female goat and fixing the second half-yearly advance for the 1990 marketing year
THE COMMISSION OF THE EUROPEAN COMMUNITIES
main_body:
A difference is hereby ascertained between the basic price and the foreseeable market price during the 1990 marketing year for the following regions:
(ECU/100 kg)
1.2 //  //  // Region  // Difference   //    //   // 1  // 121,154   // 2   // 131,859   // - Ireland - Northern Ireland   // 176,422   // 4   // 41,925   //    //

1. The estimated amount of the premium payable per ewe and per region is as follows:
(ECU)
1.2 //  //  // Region  // Estimated amount of the premium payable per ewe   //    //   // 1   // 11,688   // 2 - Ireland - Northern Ireland   // 28,084   // - Remainder of region 2  // 23,720   // 3 - [Article 22 (6) of Regulation (EEC) No 3013/89]   // 23,720   // 4 - [Article 22 (8) of Regulation (EEC) No 3013/89]   //   // - producers of heavy lambs  // 23,720   // - producers of light lambs   // 16,604   //  //
2. Pursuant to Article 5 (6) of Regulation (EEC) No 3013/89, the second half-yearly advance for the 1990 marketing year that the Member States are authorized to pay to producers shall be as follows :
(ECU)
1.2 //  //  // Region  // Advance payable per ewe   //    //  // 1   // 3,506   // 2 - Ireland,- Northern Ireland   // 8,425   // - Remainder of region 2   // 7,116   // 3 - [Article 22 (6) of Regulation (EEC) No 3013/89]   // 7,116   // 4 - [Article 22 (8) of Regulation (EEC) No 3013/89]   //   // - producers of heavy lambs   // 7,116   // - producers of light lambs   // 4,981   //    //

1. The estimated amount of the premium payable per female of the caprine species and per region in the areas designated in Annex I to Regulation (EEC) No 3013/89 and in Article 1 of Regulation (EEC) No 1065/86 is as follows:
(ECU)
1.2 //  //  // Region  // Estimated amount of the premium payable per female of the caprine species   //    //   // 2  // 18,976   // 3 [Article 22 (6) of Regulation (EEC) No 3013/89]   // 18,976   // 4 [Article 22 (8) of Regulation (EEC) 1984, p. 28. (3) OJ No L 124, 15. 5. 1990, p. 15.
2. Pursuant to Article 5 (6) of Regulation (EEC) No 3013/89, the second half-yearly advance for the 1990 marketing year which the Member States are authorized to pay to goatmeat producers located in the areas designated in paragraph 1 shall be as follows:
(ECU)
1.2 //  //  // Region  // Advance on premium payable per female of the caprine species   //    //   // 2   // 5,693  // 3 [Article 22 (6) of Regulation (EEC) No 3013/89]  // 5,693   // 4 [Article 22 (8) of Regulation (EEC) No 3013/89]   // 4,981   //    //

1. The estimated amount of the premium payable per female of the ovine, species other than eligible ewes and per region in the areas mentioned in the Annex to Regulation (EEC) No 872/84 is as follows:
(ECU)
1.2 //  //  // Region  // Estimated amount of the premium payable per female of bovine species other than eligible ewes  //    //   // 1   // 9,350   //    //
2. Pursuant to Article 5 (6) of Regulation (EEC) No 3013/89, the second half-yearly advance for the 1990 marketing year which the Member States are authorized to pay to producers holding females of the ovine species other than eligible ewes located in the areas referred to in paragraph 1 shall be as follows:
(ECU)
1.2 //  //  // Region  // Advance on premium payable per female of the ovine species other than eligible ewes   //  //   // 1   // 2,805   //    //

This Regulation shall enter into force on the day of its publication in the Official Journal of the European Communities.
This Regulation shall be binding in its entirety and directly applicable in all Member States.
